post.description: Create customer allows users to add a new customer to the system, providing essential details such as name, email, address, and phone number. By utilizing this functionality, users can easily store and manage customer information for seamless transactions and interactions within the application.

parameters.name: Authorization

schema.description: The token or credentials required to authorize the request.

parameters.name: Content-Type

schema.description: The type of content included in the request or response.

parameters.description: The type of content included in the request or response.

customer.description: The customer parameter contains details and information related to the newly created customer profile.

id.description: The unique identifier for the customer.

created_at.description: The date and time when the customer was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time when the customer information was last updated.

given_name.description: The first name of the customer.

family_name.description: The last name of the customer.

email_address.description: The email address of the customer.

address.description: The full address of the customer.

address_line_1.description: The first line of the customer's address.

address_line_2.description: The second line of the customer's address.

locality.description: The city or locality where the customer is located.

administrative_district_level_1.description: The administrative district level 1 where the customer is located.

postal_code.description: The postal code or zip code of the customer's address.

country.description: The country where the customer is located.

phone_number.description: The phone_number parameter refers to the contact number of the customer.

reference_id.description: The reference_id parameter is an identifier used to link or associate the customer with external systems or databases.

note.description: The note parameter allows users to add additional comments or notes regarding the customer during the creation process.

preferences.description: The preferences parameter allows the user to customize their settings or choices within the customer profile.

email_unsubscribed.description: The email_unsubscribed parameter indicates whether the customer has opted out of receiving email communication.

creation_source.description: The creation_source parameter specifies the method or channel through which the customer profile was created.

version.description: The version parameter indicates the API version being used for the customer creation process.

errors.description: The errors parameter provides information on any errors encountered during the customer creation process.

code.description: The code parameter represents a unique identifier or code associated with the customer.

category.description: The category parameter classifies the customer based on a specific grouping or classification criteria.

delete.description: Deletes a customer from the system permanently, and this action cannot be reversed. Additionally, it promptly cancels any active subscriptions associated with the customer.

post.description: Create a charge allows users to initiate a payment transaction and charge a customer's payment source. With this API section, users can easily process payments, handle card details securely, and ensure a seamless checkout experience for their customers.

put.description: This section allows users to update a charge by setting the values of the parameters passed. By leveraging this functionality, users can modify the details of an existing charge, such as updating the amount, description, or metadata associated with the charge.

get.description:
Note:

All of the stated endpoints and sections are for demonstration purposes only. Theneo does not manage payments API, get sales data, itemize payments, push orders to POS, and more.

post.description:
Creates a subscription to a subscription plan by a customer.

If a card on file is provided in the request, the API provider will charge the card for the subscription. Otherwise, an email invoice is sent to the customer. The subscription begins instantly unless the optional start date parameter is included in the request. Each unique subscription corresponds to a certain region.

put.description:
Updates a subscription.

You can set, modify, and clear the`subscription`field values.

post.description:
Searches for subscriptions.

Results are ordered chronologically by subscription creation date. If the request specifies more than one location ID, the endpoint orders the result by location ID, and then by creation date within each location. If no locations are given in the query, all locations are searched.

You can also optionally specify`customer_ids`to search by customer. If left unset, all customers associated with the specified locations are returned. If the request specifies customer IDs, the endpoint orders results first by location, within location by customer ID, and within customer by subscription creation date.

Schedules a`CANCEL`action to cancel an active subscription by setting the`canceled_date`field to the end of the active billing period and changing the subscription status from ACTIVE to CANCELED after this date.

get.description: This section allows users to retrieve a list of branches associated with the account. By accessing this API, users can gain insights into the different branches within a repository and their associated information.

This section allows users to retrieve detailed information about a specific branch within a repository. By accessing this functionality, users can gather essential data related to the branch, such as commit details, author information, and associated URLs, enabling them to better understand the branch's history and contributors.

message.example:
Merge pull request #6 from Spaceghost/patch-1

New line at end of file.

post.description:
Renames a branch in a repository. Note:

Although the API responds immediately, the branch rename process might take some extra time to complete in the background. You won't be able to push to the old branch name while the rename process is in progress.

 The permissions required to use this endpoint depends on whether you are renaming the default branch. To rename a non-default branch: * Users must have push access. * Apps must have the `contents:write` repository permission. To rename the default branch: * Users must have admin or owner permissions. * Apps must have the `administration:write` repository permission.

message.example:
Merge pull request #6 from Spaceghost/patch-1

New line at end of file.

get.description: This section allows users to retrieve schedule information, including details such as hours of the day, days of the week, and months. By accessing this endpoint, users can access essential scheduling data for efficient planning and management within their projects.

patch.description: This section allows users to update a schedule with specific parameters and details, such as description, timetable settings, and attribution information. By sending a request to this endpoint, users can modify existing schedules to reflect any changes or updates needed within their project or application.

delete.description: The "Delete a schedule" section allows users to remove a scheduled event or task from the system. By utilizing this functionality, users can effectively manage their schedules and ensure accurate records without unnecessary clutter. This feature provides a straightforward way to declutter and streamline the scheduling process.

post.description: This section allows users to add a new project to their account. By providing specific parameters such as project name, key, and logo, users can create a new project with customized settings. The response provides details on the successful creation of the project or any errors encountered during the process.

get.description: This section allows users to retrieve all projects associated with a specific criteria, such as company ID or publication status. By accessing this endpoint, users can obtain a list of projects along with relevant information such as project name, key, creator, and accessors. This information can be valuable for managing and monitoring projects within the platform.

The "Get project by id" section allows users to retrieve detailed information about a specific project within the system. By providing the project's unique identifier, users can access essential details such as project name, key, company ID, and creation information. This functionality enables users to efficiently access and review project-specific data for their workflow needs.

delete.description: This section allows users to delete a project from the system, removing all associated data and configurations. By utilizing this API functionality, users can efficiently manage their project list and ensure accurate data organization within the platform.

get.description: This section allows users to retrieve a list of accessible users within a specific project. Users can access information such as user IDs, names, contact details, and account status to manage project access permissions effectively.

post.description: This section allows users to share a project with other users by specifying their user IDs, email addresses, and roles. Users can choose to make the project public and opt to receive notifications when others interact with the shared project.

patch.summary: Change user access to a project
patch.description: This section allows users to modify the access permissions for a specific user within a project. By changing the user's access level or removing them entirely, users can effectively manage project collaboration and security settings. This feature provides flexibility and control over project access rights.

post.description: The Import API specification section allows users to import project data into the system, enabling seamless migration or integration of project information. With this feature, users can effortlessly transfer project details and associated data to streamline their workflow within the application.
How to create a new Customer or Supplier.

delete.description: Delete an existing Customer or Supplier.

get.description: Returns the latest invoice ID for an invoice prefix and invoice number pair.
Lists the existing bank accounts on the account.

menu.name: Customer CRM API Example
menu.description:
Note:

All of the stated endpoints and sections are for demonstration purposes only. Theneo does not manage payments API, get sales data, itemize payments, push orders to POS, and more.

subSections.name: Create customer
subSections.description: Create customer allows users to add a new customer to the system, providing essential details such as name, email, address, and phone number. By utilizing this functionality, users can easily store and manage customer information for seamless transactions and interactions within the application.

subSections.name: Update customer
subSections.description: Update customer allows users to modify and update customer information within the system. Users can easily adjust customer details such as name, email, phone number, and more. This section provides a seamless way to keep customer data accurate and up-to-date.

subSections.name: Retrieve customer
subSections.description: This section allows users to retrieve detailed information about a specific customer within the system. Users can access essential details such as the customer's name, email address, phone number, address, and creation source. By utilizing this functionality, users can efficiently manage customer data and preferences.

subSections.name: List all customers
subSections.description: This section allows users to retrieve a list of all customers associated with the project. By accessing this data, users can gain insights into their customer base, track customer interactions, and manage customer information effectively within the project.

subSections.name: Delete customer
subSections.description: Deletes a customer from the system permanently, and this action cannot be reversed. Additionally, it promptly cancels any active subscriptions associated with the customer.

menu.name: Transaction API Example
menu.description:
Note:

All of the stated endpoints and sections are for demonstration purposes only. Theneo does not manage payments API, get sales data, itemize payments, push orders to POS, and more.

subSections.name: Create a charge
subSections.description: Create a charge allows users to initiate a payment transaction and charge a customer's payment source. With this API section, users can easily process payments, handle card details securely, and ensure a seamless checkout experience for their customers.

subSections.name: Update a charge
subSections.description: This section allows users to update a charge by setting the values of the parameters passed. By leveraging this functionality, users can modify the details of an existing charge, such as updating the amount, description, or metadata associated with the charge.

subSections.name: Create subscription
subSections.description:
Creates a subscription to a subscription plan by a customer.

If a card on file is provided in the request, the API provider will charge the card for the subscription. Otherwise, an email invoice is sent to the customer. The subscription begins instantly unless the optional start date parameter is included in the request. Each unique subscription corresponds to a certain region.

subSections.name: Update subscription
subSections.description:
Updates a subscription.

You can set, modify, and clear the`subscription`field values.

subSections.name: Search subscriptions
subSections.description:
Searches for subscriptions.

Results are ordered chronologically by subscription creation date. If the request specifies more than one location ID, the endpoint orders the result by location ID, and then by creation date within each location. If no locations are given in the query, all locations are searched.

You can also optionally specify`customer_ids`to search by customer. If left unset, all customers associated with the specified locations are returned. If the request specifies customer IDs, the endpoint orders results first by location, within location by customer ID, and within customer by subscription creation date.

subSections.name: Cancel subscription
subSections.description: Schedules a`CANCEL`action to cancel an active subscription by setting the`canceled_date`field to the end of the active billing period and changing the subscription status from ACTIVE to CANCELED after this date.

menu.name: Dev Tools API Examples
menu.description:
Note:

All of the stated endpoints and sections are for demonstration purposes only. Theneo does not manage payments API, get sales data, itemize payments, push orders to POS, and more.

subSections.name: List branches
subSections.description: This section allows users to retrieve a list of branches associated with the account. By accessing this API, users can gain insights into the different branches within a repository and their associated information.

subSections.name: Get a branch
subSections.description: This section allows users to retrieve detailed information about a specific branch within a repository. By accessing this functionality, users can gather essential data related to the branch, such as commit details, author information, and associated URLs, enabling them to better understand the branch's history and contributors.

subSections.name: Rename a branch
subSections.description:
Renames a branch in a repository. Note:

Although the API responds immediately, the branch rename process might take some extra time to complete in the background. You won't be able to push to the old branch name while the rename process is in progress.

 The permissions required to use this endpoint depends on whether you are renaming the default branch. To rename a non-default branch: * Users must have push access. * Apps must have the `contents:write` repository permission. To rename the default branch: * Users must have admin or owner permissions. * Apps must have the `administration:write` repository permission.

subSections.name: Get a schedule
subSections.description: This section allows users to retrieve schedule information, including details such as hours of the day, days of the week, and months. By accessing this endpoint, users can access essential scheduling data for efficient planning and management within their projects.

subSections.name: Update a schedule
subSections.description: This section allows users to update a schedule with specific parameters and details, such as description, timetable settings, and attribution information. By sending a request to this endpoint, users can modify existing schedules to reflect any changes or updates needed within their project or application.

subSections.name: Delete a schedule
subSections.description: The "Delete a schedule" section allows users to remove a scheduled event or task from the system. By utilizing this functionality, users can effectively manage their schedules and ensure accurate records without unnecessary clutter. This feature provides a straightforward way to declutter and streamline the scheduling process.

menu.name: Theneo Real APIs
menu.description: Creating intuitive, detailed, and easy-to-navigate API documentation has never been easier. Theneo streamlines every step of the process, ensuring that your documentation is not only comprehensive but also interactive and user-friendly. Here's how you can quickly set up your project in Theneo

subSections.name: Add new project
subSections.description: This section allows users to add a new project to their account. By providing specific parameters such as project name, key, and logo, users can create a new project with customized settings. The response provides details on the successful creation of the project or any errors encountered during the process.

subSections.name: Get all projects
subSections.description: This section allows users to retrieve all projects associated with a specific criteria, such as company ID or publication status. By accessing this endpoint, users can obtain a list of projects along with relevant information such as project name, key, creator, and accessors. This information can be valuable for managing and monitoring projects within the platform.

subSections.name: Get project by id
subSections.description: The "Get project by id" section allows users to retrieve detailed information about a specific project within the system. By providing the project's unique identifier, users can access essential details such as project name, key, company ID, and creation information. This functionality enables users to efficiently access and review project-specific data for their workflow needs.

subSections.name: Delete project
subSections.description: This section allows users to delete a project from the system, removing all associated data and configurations. By utilizing this API functionality, users can efficiently manage their project list and ensure accurate data organization within the platform.

subSections.name: Get accessible users
subSections.description: This section allows users to retrieve a list of accessible users within a specific project. Users can access information such as user IDs, names, contact details, and account status to manage project access permissions effectively.

subSections.name: Share a project
subSections.description: This section allows users to share a project with other users by specifying their user IDs, email addresses, and roles. Users can choose to make the project public and opt to receive notifications when others interact with the shared project.

subSections.name: Change user access to a project
subSections.description: This section allows users to modify the access permissions for a specific user within a project. By changing the user's access level or removing them entirely, users can effectively manage project collaboration and security settings. This feature provides flexibility and control over project access rights.

subSections.name: Import API specification
subSections.description: The Import API specification section allows users to import project data into the system, enabling seamless migration or integration of project information. With this feature, users can effortlessly transfer project details and associated data to streamline their workflow within the application.
